notes.text:
This update for bind fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2022-2795: Fixed potential performance degredation due to missing database lookup limits when processing large delegations (bsc#1203614).
- CVE-2022-38177: Fixed a memory leak that could be externally triggered in the DNSSEC verification code for the ECDSA algorithm (bsc#1203619).
- CVE-2022-38178: Fixed memory leaks that could be externally triggered in the DNSSEC verification code for the EdDSA algorithm (bsc#1203620).

Bugfixes:
- Changed ownership of /var/lib/named/master from named:named to root:root (bsc#1201247)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed ECDSA signature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources.

notes.text: By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed EdDSA signature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources.
